title: Looters and land speculators move in after deadly Hawaii fires
description: In the aftermath of the deadly Maui wildfires, looters and speculators have jumped into the picture.

title: Woman who helped mutilate and conceal Vanessa Guillén’s body sentenced to 30 years in prison
description: Cecily Aguilar, the Texas woman who admittedly helped mutilate and conceal the body of soldier Vanessa Guillén, was sentenced to 30 years in prison.

title: FEMA chief says federal government has the 'right amount of personnel' aiding in Hawaii
description: FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell said the federal government currently has the "right amount of personnel on the ground" in Hawaii to help in the recovery.

title: ‘The Blind Side' subject Michael Oher says adoption by Tuohy family is a lie, he was cut out of movie money
description: Former NFL star Michael Oher, subject of the book and movie "The Blind Side," alleges that the couple who took him in as a teenager misled him into believing they were adopting him — and instead placed him in a conservatorship, according to a court filing Monday.

title: Judge in Trump's hush money case refuses to recuse himself
description: New York Judge Juan Merchan, who is overseeing the hush money criminal case against former President Donald Trump, has refused to recuse himself.

title: Earth just had its hottest July 'by a long shot,' NASA and NOAA say
description: The planet had its warmest July on record “by a long shot” — and very likely also had its warmest-ever month in 174 years of record-keeping — according to NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: Witnesses in Trump election probe spotted at Georgia courthouse ahead of possible indictments
description: Witnesses in the probe into whether former President Donald Trump and his allies interfered with the 2020 presidential election were spotted at the Fulton County courthouse.

title: The biggest companies in AI gave hackers a chance to do their worst
description: The six biggest companies in AI had a peculiar challenge for hackers last week: make their chatbots say the most terrible things.

title: Blindsided: Hours before the coup in Niger, U.S. diplomats said the country was stable
description: Hours before the recent coup in Niger, American diplomats painted a picture of a democratic government that, while imperfect, was more stable than others in the region.

title: Hunter Biden's lawyers say prosecutors reneged on plea agreement
description: Hunter Biden’s attorneys said in a court filing late Sunday that federal prosecutors had reneged on their plea agreement in the probe of the president’s son's business dealings.

title: Alarming pattern: Climate disasters hit, and Spanish-language misinformation spreads
description: More news on extreme weather events has given  rise to more Spanish-language disinformation and misinformation on climate change that Latinos see, researchers say.

title: A rising Twitter star boosted by Elon Musk has a past littered with broken promises, say ex-colleagues
description: Mario Nawfal is one of the ascendant stars on Elon Musk’s Twitter, receiving praise from Musk and frequently hosting the platform’s largest audio events.

title: 2 young Ukrainian musicians were singing in the streets — hours later they were dead
description: A pair of female Ukrainian singers known as 'Similar Girls' were killed in a Russian airstrike on Zaporizhzhia.

title: RFK Jr. walks backs abortion stance and Zuckerberg shuts door on cage fight with Musk: Morning Rundown
description: In today’s newsletter: The wildfires in Hawaii, which have now killed at least 96 people, still have many searching desperately for their family members.

title: GOP candidates prepare for the possibility Trump shows up at the debate after all
description: Donald Trump hasn’t committed to the first GOP presidential primary debate next week, but he’ll be there — whether it’s onstage or in his opponents’ heads.

title: In Georgia, cameras could sharpen the focus on Trump in the courtroom
description: If Donald Trump is indicted in Georgia, cameras are likely to be allowed in the courtroom.

title: Maui fires live updates: Search for missing goes on with death toll now 93
description: Maui fires live updates: Search for missing goes on with death toll now 93
